back.text:
Root: ع ص ر (ʿ-Ṣ-R)
Meaning: By the passage of time, by the afternoon
Pronunciation: Wal-ʿAṣr
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Qamariyyah** and **Istiʿlā** on the 'ص'.
Derived Words:
1. عَصْر (ʿAṣr): Era, time
2. عَصِير (ʿAṣīr): Juice
Example Ayah: This word is the title of the Surah.

hint.text: The oath with which the Surah begins.

back.text:
Root: أ ن س (A-N-S)
Meaning: Mankind, the human being
Pronunciation: Al-Insāna
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Qamariyyah** and **Ikhfā'** (hiding) of the Nūn.
Derived Words:
1. إِنْس (Ins): Humans
2. نَاس (Nās): People
Example Ayah: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا الْإِنسَانَ مِن صَلْصَالٍ

hint.text: The subject of the oath's statement.

back.text:
Root: خ س ر (Kh-S-R)
Meaning: Loss, destruction
Pronunciation: Khusr
Tajweed Rules: **Qalqalah** on the 'س'.
Derived Words:
1. خَاسِر (Khāsir): A loser
2. خَسَارَة (Khasārah): A loss
Example Ayah: إِنَّ الْخَاسِرِينَ الَّذِينَ خَسِرُوا أَنفُسَهُمْ

hint.text: The state of most of humanity.

back.text:
Root: ص ل ح (Ṣ-L-Ḥ)
Meaning: Righteous deeds
Pronunciation: Aṣ-Ṣāliḥāt
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Shamsiyyah** and **Istiʿlā** on 'صَا'. **Madd Tabi'i** on 'صَا' and 'حَا'.
Derived Words:
1. صَالِح (Ṣāliḥ): Righteous
2. صَلَاح (Ṣalāḥ): Righteousness
Example Ayah: وَبَشِّرِ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ

hint.text: One of the two actions that prevent loss.

back.text:
Root: و ص ي (W-Ṣ-Y)
Meaning: And advised one another
Pronunciation: Wa-tawāṣaw
Tajweed Rules: **Madd Tabi'i** on 'وَ' and 'صَا'. **Istiʿlā** on 'صَا'.
Derived Words:
1. وَصِيَّة (Waṣiyyah): A will, a recommendation
Example Ayah: وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالْحَقِّ وَتَوَاصَوْا بِالصَّبْرِ

hint.text: The action of recommending something to another.

back.text:
Root: ح ق ق (Ḥ-Q-Q)
Meaning: With the truth
Pronunciation: Bil-Ḥaqq
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Qamariyyah** and **Shaddah** on the 'قّ'.
Derived Words:
1. حَقّ (Ḥaqq): Truth, right
2. حَقِيقَة (Ḥaqīqah): A reality
Example Ayah: قُلْ جَاءَ الْحَقُّ وَزَهَقَ الْبَاطِلُ

hint.text: One of the two things to advise others with.

back.text:
Root: ص ب ر (Ṣ-B-R)
Meaning: With patience
Pronunciation: Biṣ-Ṣabr
Tajweed Rules: **Alif-Lām Shamsiyyah**, **Istiʿlā** on 'صَا', and **Qalqalah** on 'ب'.
Derived Words:
1. صَبَرَ (Ṣabara): He was patient
2. صَبُور (Ṣabūr): Very patient
Example Ayah: وَاسْتَعِينُوا بِالصَّبْرِ وَالصَّلَاةِ

hint.text: The other thing to advise others with.
